markdown:
<title level="1" right="Rules">[Step 3: Apply the Target's Immunities, Weaknesses, and Resistances](/Rules.aspx?ID=342)</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 451 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
Defenses against certain types of damage or effects are called immunities or resistances, while vulnerabilities are called weaknesses. Apply immunities first, then weaknesses, and resistances third. Immunity, weakness, or resistance to an alignment applies only to damage of that type, not to damage from an attacking creature of that alignment.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<document level="2" id="rules-343" />

<document level="2" id="rules-344" />

<document level="2" id="rules-345" />

<document level="2" id="rules-346" />
name: Step 3: Apply the Target's Immunities, Weaknesses, and Resistances
